reviews.review: Not only one of the best superhero movies I've seen, but one of the best outright movies I've seen.

Saw it on release, bought tickets for saturday, and im now seeing it friday as well. Marvel did it. They made the impossible movie it is the singular best superhero movie of all time, sorry Dark Knight your reign is over. This movie is not an absolute must watch, it is an absolute must watch rewatch watch again and then buy on blu-ray! Incredible movie, if you are wondering whether you should see it, YES! yes you should.

This movie plays with your emotions from the beginning all the way to the end. This movie was hyped up to the max and I think it exceeded expectations. In my opinion, Thanos is the modern day Darth Vader.
10/10 movie absolutely amazing!! Can't wait for part 2 next year!!
Straight up this movie is 5/5 stars!
Absolutely, fantastic. Unpredictable, beautiful to watch and had me feeling every emotion possible.

"Tal vez las bromas y los golpes estén ahí porque tienen que serlo, con el constante desfile de fracasos e incluso las muertes de la película. Los planes fallan, el personaje falla, incluso los sacrificios fallan. No es exactamente refrescante, pero es vigorizante e incluso gratificante." Quizás sea la crítica en un aspecto cinéfilo que más se acerca a lo que pienso.
Marvel por fin da al público lo que llamamos una muy buena "adaptación del cómic" a la pantalla grande, un toque de realidad y que no siempre se va a tener un final donde todos ganamos. Un final que un fan sólo del UCM no se esperaría. 
Al ver la película sentí la gran esencia del cómic de The Infinity Gauntlet, ver la presión, los sacrificios, las forma de pelear, los diálogos entre los personajes y la manera en la que empiezan a entenderse es algo que no veía desde Avengers. Ese tipo de emoción o "hype" no lo sentía desde la primera película de Iron Man e incluso Avengers. Simplemente un gran éxito el cuál me hace admirar y reconocer a Marvel tanto como lo hago con DC. ¡Joyón de película! Gracias Marvel Studios 5/5

Si quieren saber un poco de lo que se acerca en las próximas entregas de Avengers, pueden leer:

The Infinity Gauntlet: Vol. I y Vol. II
La guerra del Infinito: del #1 al #6

Y algo me dice que se acercan los... "New Avengenrs"

No wordS to describe it.... 
They did an amazing job

(No spoiler review)

My 2 cents on Avengers Infinity War.  

I always thought that a team superhero movie always had an inherent disadvantage when being critically compared to a solo superhero movie focusing on one hero.

Mostly because a movie that focuses on a single hero has more resources (time) to develop the plot and character, and not hampered with the "circus factor", that can potentially plague a movie that focuses on a team of heroes.

From a purely critical perspective, the world's top five movies are:

1  The Dark Knight 
      critic score 94
      audience score 94

2  Iron Man (part 1)
     critic score 94
      audience score 91
     
3  Logan
     critic score 93
      audience score 90

4  Superman (Christopher Reeve)
     critic score 93
      audience score 86

5  Spiderman 2 (Tobey Maguire)
     critic score 93
      audience score 81

Source: (https://quartzy.qz.com/1143813/the-all-time-greatest-superhero-movies-ranked-by-rotten-tomatoes/)

The world's critical top five is also my critical top five.

I absolutely concur with the world on this ranking.

As of today (4-27-18)  Avengers Infinity War has a current score of:

     critic score 84
      audience score 93

The audience score is 1 point away from the dark knight.

As much as I love the world's top five, if Infinity War somehow catches up and gets on the top five, I wouldn't mind at all.

That's how good this movie is.

Thanos is a magnificent villain.  His character development is absolutely incredible.  Never in a million years could I possibly imagine that a CGI character could be this compelling.

Not only was his CGI flawless, and above reproach in terms aesthetics, but his character development ranks him as one of the best MCU villains of all time.

Some of the most memorable MCU villains popping into my head right now are 

Loki from Avengers.  
Erik Killmonger from Black Panther.

Josh Brolin as Thanos, despite being a CGI character ranks up there with the best of the MCU villains of all time, in my humble opinion.

I also love the fact that the most beloved heroes of the MCU were given the opportunity to shine as well.  I didn't feel like any of them were upstaged.

This movie is 2 and a half hours, and it doesn't feel like it at all.  It goes by fast.  No pacing issues.  Every single minute of this movie either serves the plot, or the character development.  Not a single minute wasted.

I'm utterly amazed at how Marvel never seems to drop the ball..... ever.

I was so glad that Roger Ebert was alive long enough to give a review for the second installment of the Christopher Nolan's trilogy: "The Dark Knight"

Roger Ebert felt that the Dark Knight transcended the comic book movie genre.

His exact words:

"Batman" isn't a comic book anymore. Christopher Nolan's "The Dark Knight" is a haunted film that leaps beyond its origins and becomes an engrossing tragedy.

The Infinity War kinda makes me wish Roger Ebert was still alive.  I wonder if he would feel the same about the Infinity War transcending the comics as well.
